meanings.definition: A small adhesive strip or patch applied to cover a minor wound or injury.
meanings.sent1: I put a bandaid on my finger after I got a small cut.
meanings.sent2: She always carries a bandaid in her purse in case of emergencies.
meanings.sent3: The bandaid on his knee made him feel like a superhero with a special power.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a bandaid on my heart, healing all my pain.
meanings.sent5: The colorful bandaid stood out on his arm, brightening up his day.

meanings.definition: To apply a bandaid to a cut or scrape to protect it from infection.
meanings.sent1: Mom will bandaid your knee before you go out to play.
meanings.sent2: Remember to bandaid any wounds to keep them clean and safe.
meanings.sent3: He tried to bandaid the situation by offering her a cookie.
meanings.sent4: Her kind words acted like a bandaid, soothing his worries.
meanings.sent5: The apology was a bandaid on their friendship, but it needed more to heal.
